text: Now as we continue the discussion on the control variables, it's important to understand what the various control variables might mean, whether they're strong or weak, but it's also crucial to understand where these control variables are occurring. control variables around reference points. And those reference points can be daily, weekly, monthly highs and lows, that can be key bracketed regions, that can be consolidated structural breaks. Now it's important to understand if we expect to see a lot of strength and potential for low volume areas when we break out of a consolidated area, We need to incorporate that into our strategy development, whereas for instance if we want to develop two-way trade type strategies, then we need to identify at which point would we likely see or at which reference points would we likely see the various control variables. As an example remember when we see key breaks key breakouts whether you know They they trend continuation patterns or a break of a consolidation or even just a breakout of the previous day's range We need to see that initiative response and that initiative response Will imply a new business as well as a new positioning and this is where the opportunity is because we should, in theory, see continuation of trend. If we do not, we will get a very aggressive reversal. Why? Because there's positioning or new positioning in the market that thus needs to unwind. So that is why we pay close attention, you know, to the various control variables around key reference points. Now note, as we've said there, failure to follow through is just as significant as no follow through. If you're a momentum trader and you've got a lot of momentum patterns, don't just always analyze it from one side. be flexible, be nimble, because some of the best reversals and best opportunities lie in the face of adversity or go against what everyone is doing. So make sure when something doesn't work out, always look at it from the other side. Is there an opportunity that So, some of our price expectations and hypothesis development. What do we mean by that? Well, the importance of pattern recognition is not in the act of labeling different market structures. Rather, it is essential for understanding current market activity, but most important learning to visualize future market development.

text: So, some of our price expectations and hypothesis development. What do we mean by that? Well, the importance of pattern recognition is not in the act of labeling different market structures. Rather, it is essential for understanding current market activity, but most important learning to visualize future market development. It's not so important recognizing the patterns and having all these trade setups and all these principles. It's more important to just make sure you're always keeping up with the current market activity. Always trying to see what is the market doing now versus what it's telling me. What should the market have done versus what it was telling me. That's how you want to look at the markets because when you start to look at the markets from this blank canvas, non-biased view where you're paying attention purely to early pattern recognition, almost like filling in the puzzle before the market is able to do it. And if you're able to do that, you will become a highly effective volume profiling trader. Let's now turn our attention to three of the most, or three very common profile or volume profile strategies we'll see for the rest of this module.
